definitions.definition: ( countable , uncountable ) Real or perceived movement of atmospheric air usually caused by convection or differences in air pressure .
examples: The wind blew through her hair as she stood on the deck of the ship.
As they accelerated onto the motorway, the wind tore the plywood off the car's roof-rack.
The winds in Chicago are fierce.
There was a sudden gust of wind , on which spores were borne away.
The window was banging in the wind .

definitions.definition: Air artificially put in motion by any force or action.
examples: the wind of a cannon ball

definitions.definition: ( countable , uncountable ) The ability to breathe easily.
examples: After the second lap he was already out of wind .
The fall knocked the wind out of him.

definitions.definition: ( figurative ) News of an event, especially by hearsay or gossip .
examples: Steve caught wind of Martha's dalliance with his best friend.

definitions.definition: ( philosophy , alchemy ) One of the four elements of the ancient Greeks and Romans ; air .
One of the five basic elements in Indian and Japanese models of the Classical elements .
Breath modulated by the respiratory and vocal organs, or by an instrument.
( music ) The woodwind section of an orchestra.  Occasionally also used to include the brass section.
( music ) A woodwind instrument.  Occasionally also used to describe a brass instrument.
A direction from which the wind may blow; a point of the compass ; especially, one of the cardinal points .
Types of playing-tile in the game of mah-jongg, named after the four winds.
A disease of sheep , in which the intestines are distended with air, or rather affected with a violent inflammation . It occurs immediately after shearing .
( figurative ) Mere breath or talk; empty effort; idle words.
( boxing , slang ) The region of the solar plexus , where a blow may paralyze the diaphragm and cause temporary loss of breath or other injury.

definitions.definition: The act of winding or turning; a turn; a bend; a twist.

main_definition: The act of winding or turning; a turn; a bend; a twist.
